dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Do you remember the time I flirted with all
sentences.chinese: 我故意跟衆人打情罵俏。

sentences.english: This is important when you flirt with a girl.
sentences.chinese: 這在你和女孩打情罵俏的時候尤爲重要。

sentences.english: Prince daily and ZhangLiHua flirting, bender.
sentences.chinese: 太子每日與張麗華打情罵俏，飲酒作樂。

sentences.english: Kino should be fun and flirty during this stage – anythingdominant and push-pull is great.
sentences.chinese: 在這一階段kino應該是有趣且打情罵俏的。

sentences.english: All the girls hit on him in class.
sentences.chinese: 班裏的女孩們都喜歡和他打情罵俏。

sentences.english: All the girls hit on him in the class.
sentences.chinese: 班上的女孩子們都喜歡和他打情罵俏。

sentences.english: When Eric and Yeung Sau Wai exchanged their rings, they had a sweet and happy couple's fight.
sentences.chinese: 孫耀威與楊秀惠交換戒指打情罵俏，相當親熱。

sentences.english: Day and night online, chat bubble sister, philandering, reckless.
sentences.chinese: 晝夜上網，聊天泡妹，打情罵俏，膽大妄爲。

(Tw) from time to time/frequently

the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view

to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
